page.title: 07BRODSWORTH MAIN COLLIERY
page.content: Opened 23rd Oct 1905.During 1906-7 two shafts sunk under control of{Sir {Arthur Markham,}engineer to Hickleton Main Colliery and Staveley Coal & Iron Company.This was the 'Barnsley' seam(800m deep).Good quality coal used by Royal household and pit known as 'King's Pit'.In 1923 further shaft sunk -'Parkgate' seam(550m deep). All shafts are 6m wide. In 1947 colliery nationalised.First days output-57 ton. Record day-6777 ton.By 1955,largest pit in Britain.By 1970,largest in Europe.In 1954-3625 men working, 1979-3000 men, 1985-1482 men. Produced more than one million tons of coal annually.75% coal used by local power stations. Other users-domestic, steel works, some export.Today colliery works 9 faces on 4 seams, 1.5 to 2m thick. Future prospects not good.Coal mined more economically elsewhere.
